com.zrd.rtp.model.measurements

Class Velocity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zrd.rtp.model.measurements.Measurement
      • com.zrd.rtp.model.measurements.Velocity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Measurement>

    public class Velocity
extends Measurement
    This class is meant to be an object that represents a single velocity. It will be mainly used for the accurate time estimator. It will construct a velocity from either miles per hour, km per hour, or meters and seconds. For each leg of a journey, google will return the distance value in meters and the time value in seconds, hence the basis being meters and seconds. To support both english and imperial units, it can return the text of the speed in either miles per hour or kilometers per hour. The following facts are used for the conversion: '1 mile = 1609.34 meters', '1 km = 1000 meters', and '1 hour = 3600 seconds'
    Author:
    Zach DeStefano

      • constructUsingMetersAndSeconds

        public static Velocity constructUsingMetersAndSeconds(double numMeters,
                                      double numSeconds)
        This constructs a new velocity object after taking in the number of meters and the number of seconds for a particular leg. The input is this way due to how the values are given by Google Directions API.
        Parameters:
        numMeters - the number of meters in a leg
        numSeconds - the number of seconds in a leg
        Returns:
        velocity object representing the average speed during the leg
